metadata.title: USN-4365-1 -- Bind vulnerabilities
metadata.description: Lior Shafir, Yehuda Afek, and Anat Bremler-Barr discovered that Bind incorrectly limited certain fetches. A remote attacker could possibly use this issue to cause Bind to consume resources, leading to a denial of service, or possibly use Bind to perform a reflection attack. (CVE-2020-8616)  Tobias Klein discovered that Bind incorrectly handled checking TSIG validity. A remote attacker could use this issue to cause Bind to crash, resulting in a denial of service, or possibly perform other attacks. (CVE-2020-8617)  Update Instructions:  Run `sudo pro fix USN-4365-1` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected by updating your system to the following package versions:  dnsutils - 1:9.16.1-0ubuntu2.1 bind9-libs - 1:9.16.1-0ubuntu2.1 bind9utils - 1:9.16.1-0ubuntu2.1 bind9-doc - 1:9.16.1-0ubuntu2.1 bind9-utils - 1:9.16.1-0ubuntu2.1 bind9 - 1:9.16.1-0ubuntu2.1 bind9-dnsutils - 1:9.16.1-0ubuntu2.1 bind9-host - 1:9.16.1-0ubuntu2.1 No subscription required
